p: Identification of the direct zoonotic origin (intermediate host) of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is important for combating the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.1,2 It has become well accepted that SARS-CoV-2 was likely to originate naturally from bats soon after its outbreak, built on the fact that SARS-CoV-2 shares a 96.2% nucleotide sequence identity with the bat coronavirus (CoV) RaTG13 isolated from Rhinolophus affinis(3) and that natural insertions were identified at the S1/S2 cleavage site of the Spike (S) protein of RmYN02-CoV isolated from Rhinolophus malayanus.4 However, it remains unknown how the related CoV was transmitted from bats to humans.
